description:
ELISA (enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay) is a plate-based assay technique designed for detecting and quantifying peptides, proteins, antibodies, and hormones. In an ELISA, an antigen must be immobilized to a solid surface and then complexed with an antibody that is linked to an enzyme. Detection is accomplished by assessing the conjugated enzyme activity via incubation with a substrate to produce a measurable product. The most crucial element of the detection strategy is a highly specific antibody-antigen interaction.

 

This protocol describes the steps for performing sandwich ELISA.
keywords: elisa, sandwich elisa, enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay, immunoassay
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working.

components.data: Sample Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
The procedure below provides a general guide for preparing commonly tested samples used in ELISA assays. Please check the literature for experiments similar to yours for your new assay development. In this protocol, the following samples are covered:

  1. Cell Culture Supernatant
  2. Cell Culture (Conditioned) Media
  3. Cell Lysate
  4. Tissue Homogenate
  5. Tissue (Bone)
  6. Serum
  7. Plasma
  8. Urine
  9. Saliva
  10. Milk
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The procedure below provides a general guide for preparing commonly tested samples used in ELISA assays. Please check the literature for experiments similar to yours for your new assay development. In this protocol, the following samples are covered:

  1. Cell Culture Supernatant
  2. Cell Culture (Conditioned) Media
  3. Cell Lysate
  4. Tissue Homogenate
  5. Tissue (Bone)
  6. Serum
  7. Plasma
  8. Urine
  9. Saliva
  10. Milk

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation:
General tips for ELISA sample preparation:

  • Serum, plasma, cell and tissue extracts are typically diluted by 50% with binding buffer.
  • Total protein concentration of homogenate should be at least 1 mg/mL. However, 2 mg/mL or more would be better.
  • The collected samples can be kept for different periods: 48 hours (2-8°C), 1 month (-20°C), or 6 months (-70°C).
  • The protein concentration of your lysates can be determined by a total protein assay not inhibited by detergents such as the Bicinchoninic acid (BCA) assay. The volume of each sample can also be normalized to deliver the same amount of total protein for each assay.
source_data.thread_text:
General tips for ELISA sample preparation:

  • Serum, plasma, cell and tissue extracts are typically diluted by 50% with binding buffer.
  • Total protein concentration of homogenate should be at least 1 mg/mL. However, 2 mg/mL or more would be better.
  • The collected samples can be kept for different periods: 48 hours (2-8°C), 1 month (-20°C), or 6 months (-70°C).
  • The protein concentration of your lysates can be determined by a total protein assay not inhibited by detergents such as the Bicinchoninic acid (BCA) assay. The volume of each sample can also be normalized to deliver the same amount of total protein for each assay.
source_data.body:
General tips for ELISA sample preparation:

  • Serum, plasma, cell and tissue extracts are typically diluted by 50% with binding buffer.
  • Total protein concentration of homogenate should be at least 1 mg/mL. However, 2 mg/mL or more would be better.
  • The collected samples can be kept for different periods: 48 hours (2-8°C), 1 month (-20°C), or 6 months (-70°C).
  • The protein concentration of your lysates can be determined by a total protein assay not inhibited by detergents such as the Bicinchoninic acid (BCA) assay. The volume of each sample can also be normalized to deliver the same amount of total protein for each assay.

components.data: Sample Preparation - Cell Culture (Conditioned) Media
components.name: Section

components.data: Since serum tends to contain cytokines which may produce significant background signals, we suggest the preparation of serum-free or low-serum medium samples. If it is necessary to test serum containing medium, we also suggest running an uncultured medium blank to obtain the baseline signals which can then be subtracted from the cultured media sample data.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Since serum tends to contain cytokines which may produce significant background signals, we suggest the preparation of serum-free or low-serum medium samples. If it is necessary to test serum containing medium, we also suggest running an uncultured medium blank to obtain the baseline signals which can then be subtracted from the cultured media sample data.

components.data: Plate cells in complete growth media (with serum) until the desired level of confluence is achieved.
components.name: Description

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 5 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation: The optimal number of seeded cells varies from one cell type to another and may need to be empirically determined. We suggest seeding around 1 million cells in 100 mm tissue culture plate with complete growth medium.
source_data.thread_text: The optimal number of seeded cells varies from one cell type to another and may need to be empirically determined. We suggest seeding around 1 million cells in 100 mm tissue culture plate with complete growth medium.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 14 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation:
Guidelines on lysis buffer

  • Avoid more than 0.1% SDS or other strongly denaturing detergents. In general, non-ionic detergents such as Triton X-100 or NP-40 are best. Zwitterionic detergents such as CHAPS or mild ionic detergents such as sodium deoxycholate will work. 
  • Do not use more than 2% v/v total detergent.  
  • Avoid the use of sodium azide. 
  • Avoid more than 10 mM reducing agents (e.g. dithiothreitol, mercaptoethanols).
source_data.thread_text:
Guidelines on lysis buffer

  • Avoid more than 0.1% SDS or other strongly denaturing detergents. In general, non-ionic detergents such as Triton X-100 or NP-40 are best. Zwitterionic detergents such as CHAPS or mild ionic detergents such as sodium deoxycholate will work. 
  • Do not use more than 2% v/v total detergent.  
  • Avoid the use of sodium azide. 
  • Avoid more than 10 mM reducing agents (e.g. dithiothreitol, mercaptoethanols).
source_data.body:
Guidelines on lysis buffer

  • Avoid more than 0.1% SDS or other strongly denaturing detergents. In general, non-ionic detergents such as Triton X-100 or NP-40 are best. Zwitterionic detergents such as CHAPS or mild ionic detergents such as sodium deoxycholate will work. 
  • Do not use more than 2% v/v total detergent.  
  • Avoid the use of sodium azide. 
  • Avoid more than 10 mM reducing agents (e.g. dithiothreitol, mercaptoethanols).

components.data: Sample Preparation - Tissue Homogenate
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare the extraction buffer. It can be prepared ahead of time and stored at 4°C.

  • 100 mM Tris, pH 7.4
  • 150 mM NaCl
  • 1 mM EGTA
  • 1 mM EDTA
  • 1% Triton X-100 0.5%
  • 0.5% sodium deoxycholate
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the extraction buffer. It can be prepared ahead of time and stored at 4°C.

  • 100 mM Tris, pH 7.4
  • 150 mM NaCl
  • 1 mM EGTA
  • 1 mM EDTA
  • 1% Triton X-100 0.5%
  • 0.5% sodium deoxycholate

components.data: Sample Preparation - Tissue Homogenate
components.name: Section

components.data:
Immediately before use, the extraction buffer must be supplemented with the following to generate a complete extraction buffer:

  • Phosphatase inhibitor cocktail (as directed by manufacturer)
  • Protease inhibitor cocktail (as directed by manufacturer)
  • PMSF (Phenyl Methyl Sulfonyl Floride) to 1 mM
components.name: Description

  • Protease inhibitor cocktail (as directed by manufacturer)
  • PMSF (Phenyl Methyl Sulfonyl Floride) to 1 mM

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 28 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation: Hemolysis should be avoided while collecting serum samples. Samples that have undergone hemolysis may increase non-specific staining in HRP-conjugated ELISA assays.
source_data.thread_text: Hemolysis should be avoided while collecting serum samples. Samples that have undergone hemolysis may increase non-specific staining in HRP-conjugated ELISA assays.

components.data: Reagent Preparation - Standard Solutions
components.name: Section

components.data:
• 10,000 pg/mL: Add 1 mL of sample diluent buffer into one tube of standard (10 ng per tube) and mix thoroughly. Store this solution at 4°C for up to 12 hours (or -20°C for 48 hours) and avoid freeze-thaw cycles.
  • 5,000 pg/mL: Mix 0.3 mL of 10,000 pg/mL with 0.3 mL of sample diluent buffer and mix thoroughly.
  • 2,500 pg/mL: Mix 0.3 mL of 5,000 pg/mL with 0.3 mL of sample diluent buffer and mix thoroughly.
  • Perform similar dilutions until the standard solutions with these concentrations (pg/mL) are made: 1250, 625, 312, 156, and 78.
  • Add 100 µL of each of the diluted standard solutions to the appropriate empty wells. Repeat in duplicate or triplicate for accuracy.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• 10,000 pg/mL: Add 1 mL of sample diluent buffer into one tube of standard (10 ng per tube) and mix thoroughly. Store this solution at 4°C for up to 12 hours (or -20°C for 48 hours) and avoid freeze-thaw cycles.
  • 5,000 pg/mL: Mix 0.3 mL of 10,000 pg/mL with 0.3 mL of sample diluent buffer and mix thoroughly.
  • 2,500 pg/mL: Mix 0.3 mL of 5,000 pg/mL with 0.3 mL of sample diluent buffer and mix thoroughly.
  • Perform similar dilutions until the standard solutions with these concentrations (pg/mL) are made: 1250, 625, 312, 156, and 78.
  • Add 100 µL of each of the diluted standard solutions to the appropriate empty wells. Repeat in duplicate or triplicate for accuracy.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation: The standard solutions are best used within 2 hours.
source_data.thread_text: The standard solutions are best used within 2 hours.
source_data.body: The standard solutions are best used within 2 hours.

components.data: Reagent Preparation - Biotinylated Antibody
components.name: Section

components.data:
• Calculate the total volume needed for the assay by multiplying 0.1 mL/well and the number of wells required. Add 2-3 extra wells to the calculated number of wells to account for possible pipetting errors.
  • Generate the required volume of diluted antibody by performing a 1:100 dilution (For each 1 µL concentrated antibody, add 99 µL antibody dilution buffer) and mixing thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Calculate the total volume needed for the assay by multiplying 0.1 mL/well and the number of wells required. Add 2-3 extra wells to the calculated number of wells to account for possible pipetting errors.
  • Generate the required volume of diluted antibody by performing a 1:100 dilution (For each 1 µL concentrated antibody, add 99 µL antibody dilution buffer) and mixing thoroughly.

components.data: Reagent Preparation - Avidin-Biotin-Peroxidase Complex (ABC)
components.name: Section

components.data:
• Calculate the total volume needed for the assay by multiplying 0.1 mL/well and the number of wells required. Add 2-3 extra wells to the calculated number of wells to account for possible pipetting errors.
  • Generate the required volume of diluted ABC solution by performing a 1:100 dilution (For each 1 µL concentrated ABC solution, add 99 µL ABC dilution buffer) and mixing thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Calculate the total volume needed for the assay by multiplying 0.1 mL/well and the number of wells required. Add 2-3 extra wells to the calculated number of wells to account for possible pipetting errors.
  • Generate the required volume of diluted ABC solution by performing a 1:100 dilution (For each 1 µL concentrated ABC solution, add 99 µL ABC dilution buffer) and mixing thoroughly.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 47 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation: The diluted ABC solution should not be prepared more than 1 hour prior to the experiment.
source_data.thread_text: The diluted ABC solution should not be prepared more than 1 hour prior to the experiment.
source_data.body: The diluted ABC solution should not be prepared more than 1 hour prior to the experiment.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol
components.name: Section

components.data: All of the ELISA kits from Boster use the sandwich format and biotin-streptavidin chemistry. Our ELISA assays require the dilutions of standard solutions, biotinylated antibody (detection antibody), and avidin-biotin-peroxidase complex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: All of the ELISA kits from Boster use the sandwich format and biotin-streptavidin chemistry. Our ELISA assays require the dilutions of standard solutions, biotinylated antibody (detection antibody), and avidin-biotin-peroxidase complex.

components.data: Pipette 100 μL of diluted antibody to each well of a microtiter plate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 100 μL of diluted antibody to each well of a microtiter plate.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)

components.data: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate at 4°C overnight (or 37°C for 30 minutes).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate at 4°C overnight (or 37°C for 30 minutes).

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)

components.data: Remove the coating solution and wash the plate 3X with 200 μL PBS (Phosphate Buffered Saline) buffer (10 mM Na2HPO4 and 1.8 mM NaH2PO4 in deionized water with 0.2% Tween 20; pH Adjusted to 7.4) for 5 minutes each time. The coating/washing solutions can be removed by flicking the plate over a sink. The remaining drops can be removed by patting the plate on a paper towel or by aspiration. Do not allow the wells to dry out at any time.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the coating solution and wash the plate 3X with 200 μL PBS (Phosphate Buffered Saline) buffer (10 mM Na2HPO4 and 1.8 mM NaH2PO4 in deionized water with 0.2% Tween 20; pH Adjusted to 7.4) for 5 minutes each time. The coating/washing solutions can be removed by flicking the plate over a sink. The remaining drops can be removed by patting the plate on a paper towel or by aspiration. Do not allow the wells to dry out at any time.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Capture Antibody Coating (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)

components.data: Dilute the capture antibody to a ﬁnal concentration of 1-10 μg/mL in bicarbonate/carbonate antigen-coating buﬀer (100 mM NaHCO3 in deionized water; pH adjusted to 9.6).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute the capture antibody to a ﬁnal concentration of 1-10 μg/mL in bicarbonate/carbonate antigen-coating buﬀer (100 mM NaHCO3 in deionized water; pH adjusted to 9.6).

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Blocking (Not required if using Boster's pre-adsorbed PicoKine ELISA kits)

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Reagent Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare the diluted standard solutions, biotinylated antibody and ABC solutions as described in the above Reagent Preparation section.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the diluted standard solutions, biotinylated antibody and ABC solutions as described in the above Reagent Preparation section.

components.data: Serially dilute the sample with blocking buffer immediately before use. The optimal dilution should be determined by a titration assay according to the antibody manufacturer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Serially dilute the sample with blocking buffer immediately before use. The optimal dilution should be determined by a titration assay according to the antibody manufacturer.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Sample (Antigen) Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette 100 μL of each of the diluted sample solutions and control to each empty well. Repeat in duplicate or triplicate for accuracy. The negative control should be species- and isotype-matched as well as non-specific immunoglobulin diluted in PBS buffer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 100 μL of each of the diluted sample solutions and control to each empty well. Repeat in duplicate or triplicate for accuracy. The negative control should be species- and isotype-matched as well as non-specific immunoglobulin diluted in PBS buffer.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Sample (Antigen) Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 2 hours at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 2 hours at room temperature.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Sample (Antigen) Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS buﬀer for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS buﬀer for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Sample (Antigen) Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Biotinylated Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Biotinylated Antibody Incubation

components.data: Pipette 100 μL of diluted antibody to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 100 μL of diluted antibody to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.

components.data: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 1 hour at 37°C (or 2 hours at room temperature). These incubation times should be sufficient to receive a strong signal. However, if a weak signal is observed, perform incubation overnight at 4°C for a stronger signal.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 1 hour at 37°C (or 2 hours at room temperature). These incubation times should be sufficient to receive a strong signal. However, if a weak signal is observed, perform incubation overnight at 4°C for a stronger signal.

components.name: Section

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Biotinylated Antibody Incubation
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Biotinylated Antibody Incubation

components.data: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - ABC Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette 100 μL of diluted ABC solution to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 100 μL of diluted ABC solution to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.

components.data: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 0.5 hour at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Cover the plate with adhesive plastic and incubate for 0.5 hour at 37°C.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - ABC Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - ABC Incubation
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS buﬀer for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the content in the wells and wash them 3X with 200 μL PBS buﬀer for 5 minutes each time. Flick the plate and pat the plate as described in the coating step.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Substrate Preparation
components.name: Section

components.data:
Prepare the substrate solution immediately before use or bring the pre-made substrate to room temperature. The two widely used enzymes for signal detection are horseradish peroxidase (HRP) and alkaline phosphatase (AP), and their corresponding substrates, stopping solutions, detection absorbance wavelengths and color developed are as follows:

 

Enzyme Substrate* Stop Solution Absorbance (nm) Color Developed
HRP TMB 2M H2SO4 450 Yellow
AP pNPP 0.75M NaOH 405 Yellow

* TMB: 3,3’,5,5’-tetramethylbenzidine; pNPP: p-nitrophenyl-phosphate
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare the substrate solution immediately before use or bring the pre-made substrate to room temperature. The two widely used enzymes for signal detection are horseradish peroxidase (HRP) and alkaline phosphatase (AP), and their corresponding substrates, stopping solutions, detection absorbance wavelengths and color developed are as follows:

 

Enzyme Substrate* Stop Solution Absorbance (nm) Color Developed
HRP TMB 2M H2SO4 450 Yellow
AP pNPP 0.75M NaOH 405 Yellow

* TMB: 3,3’,5,5’-tetramethylbenzidine; pNPP: p-nitrophenyl-phosphate

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 67 of ELISA Protocol
source_data.annotation:
• The TMB substrate must be kept at 37°C for 30 minutes before use.
  • Hydrogen peroxide can also act as a substrate for HRP.
  • Sodium azide is an inhibitor of HRP. Do not include the azide in buffers or wash solutions if HRP-labeled conjugate is used for detection.
source_data.thread_text:
• The TMB substrate must be kept at 37°C for 30 minutes before use.
  • Hydrogen peroxide can also act as a substrate for HRP.
  • Sodium azide is an inhibitor of HRP. Do not include the azide in buffers or wash solutions if HRP-labeled conjugate is used for detection.
source_data.body:
• The TMB substrate must be kept at 37°C for 30 minutes before use.
  • Hydrogen peroxide can also act as a substrate for HRP.
  • Sodium azide is an inhibitor of HRP. Do not include the azide in buffers or wash solutions if HRP-labeled conjugate is used for detection.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Signal Detection
components.name: Section

components.data: Pipette 90 μL of substrate solution to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pipette 90 μL of substrate solution to the wells with the control, the standard solutions, and the diluted samples.

components.data: Incubate the plate at 37°C in the dark. If TMB is used, shades of blue will be observed in the wells with the most concentrated solutions. Other wells may show no obvious color.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the plate at 37°C in the dark. If TMB is used, shades of blue will be observed in the wells with the most concentrated solutions. Other wells may show no obvious color.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Signal Detection
components.name: Section

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Signal Detection
components.name: Section

components.data: Color should be developed in positive wells after 15 minutes. After sufficient color development, pipette 100 μL of stop solution to the appropriate wells (if necessary).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Color should be developed in positive wells after 15 minutes. After sufficient color development, pipette 100 μL of stop solution to the appropriate wells (if necessary).

components.data: Read the absorbance (OD: Optical Density) of each well with a plate reader.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Read the absorbance (OD: Optical Density) of each well with a plate reader.

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Signal Detection
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare a standard curve using the data produced from the diluted standard solutions. Use absorbance on the Y-axis (linear) and concentration on the X-axis (log scale).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare a standard curve using the data produced from the diluted standard solutions. Use absorbance on the Y-axis (linear) and concentration on the X-axis (log scale).

components.data: Sandwich ELISA Protocol - Data Analysis
components.name: Section

components.data: Interpret the sample concentration from the standard curve.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Interpret the sample concentration from the standard curve.
